system.biography:
TitleFFF 804e Gargu-Khanu Warrior
Birthday8 Nuzyael 709
AppearanceAge 10, height 5’6”, massive frame (size 7), weight 174 lb, ugly appearance, pallid complexion, black hair, black eyes.
Medical/PsycheMute, Gigantism, Violent Temper (Moderate, resist on WIL×3; Severe when attacked, resist on WIL×1).
Size0
ArmorLeather girdle, Kurbul half-helm. Battleaxe.
Other EquipmentNecklace of Gargun teeth.
Valuables
NotesWill only engage in combat if attacked or ordered to do so by Bran.

Biography

Gargun are blessed, by dint of their genetics, with a racial memory that includes the basics of their language, customs, and fighting. Apart from needing a few years to physically mature, gargun young are able to effortlessly integrate themselves into the hive.

No one knows why Pinka was born different. Perhaps too little offal was placed around his egg. Maybe the egg was mishandled in the nest. Most gargun with any obvious physical defect are immediately killed and eaten, or quickly die from accident or murder. Likewise, those with mental defects soon die, being unable to protect themselves in competitive gargun society. Pinka was able to survive to adulthood through the care and sheltering of Bran, a Gargu-araki servant.

Although Pinka is an idiot even by gargun standards, his phenomenal size and strength offset his diminutive mind. So long as his friend Bran is there to protect him from the machinations of other gargun, Pinka is able to survive.

Pinka’s defect leaves him unable to speak, but he occasionally grunts something that sounds like “Narf.” He looks to Bran for direction and will grow violently agitated if his friend isn’t there when a decision is needed. Otherwise, Pinka prefers to stand around and drool.

Pinka comes alive during danger, however, as his basic gargun instincts need no guidance to maim and kill. A frightening sight it is, indeed, when the hulking Khanu is effortlessly splitting the heads of foes with his huge axe, his eyes animated with the joy of slaughter. Only Bran is able to snap his friend out of his madness when blood starts flowing.

HOOKS

Narf! The PCs are attacking a gargun nest and encounter Pinka while Bran is not around. Pinka pulls his finger out of his nose and gives a little wave. Unless the PCs harm Bran or Pinka, he’s harmless.

Help! The PCs find a badly wounded Pinka in the wilderness, his friend Bran frantically trying to heal him. Bran pleads for help. He can offer rare and valuable herbs as payment. PCs who help save Pinka will receive the garguns’ gratitude. Killing Bran will rouse Pinka from his stupor into a berserk fury.

What is it, Boy? Pinka’s friend Bran was gravely hurt during an assassination attempt. Pinka is frantically looking for help. He finds the PCs and tries to get them to follow. The PCs don’t understand the sign language that Bran and Pinka share. Pinka grows more agitated if the PCs don’t do anything. Interpreting Pinka’s actions as hostile will lead to lethal consequences.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
